title: Samba drive on Windows show half of the correct size

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I have a samba drive with port 9445. Section of `rclone.conf`
```
[mysmbdrive]
type = smb
host = localhost
user = laggykiller
port = 9445
pass = <redacted>
```
`mysmbdrive` contains a share named `Library`. It is hosted by Arch Linux samba.

I mount the drive on Windows by  `rclone.exe mount mysmbdrive:/Library D:`

The disk capacity and free space should be double than it shows:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61652821/215488698-43900683-baed-42e4-85fb-138986c16868.png)

However note that file sizes of the files are correctly displayed.

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
```
rclone v1.62.0-beta.6692.6b17044f8
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 11 Education 22H2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.25201.1000 Build 25201.1000.1000 (x86_64)
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.20rc3
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount
```


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Windows 11, 64 bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Samba


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
 `rclone.exe mount mysmbdrive:/Library D:`
